body:
> A third option is to dlopen, dlsym and invoke each call dynamically, which is horrific and doesn't deserve being mentioned :-) That's the only way to lazily load libopenal in our case.

FWIW we took that approach (see [al.c](https://github.com/azul3d/native-al/blob/master/al.c) and [al.go](https://github.com/azul3d/native-al/blob/master/al.go)) and, indeed, it's pretty horrific. If it's useful feel free to use it as a reference.

It does have the added benefit of allowing self-extraction (single-binary-'like' deployment) on desktop OS's though (see [docs here](https://godoc.org/azul3d.org/native/al.v1)).
